    Jonggi Hong

    I am a PhD candidate in Computer Science at University of Maryland, College Park.

    • College Park, MD, USA
    • Email
    • Twitter
    • LinkedIn
    • Google Scholar

    I am a PhD candidate in Computer Science Dept. at University of Maryland, College Park. My advisor is Professor Hernisa Kacorri. My research interest is about addressing the real-world problems using human-computer interaction and machine learning techniques. I build machine learning applications and investigate interactions between a user and the application using quantitative and qualitative analysis. In my recent projects, I explored the challenges of identifying errors from speech recognizer and conducted user studies to facilitate machine teaching with a teachable object recognizer for non-experts.

    Currently, I am in the job market. If you are hiring, please reach out to me by email. (jhong12@umd.edu)

    Projects

    The overarching theme of my research is designing and evaluating accessible interactions with emerging technologies such as wearables and AI-infused applications.

    Teachable interface for personalizing an object recognizer. Identifying speech recognition errors with audio-only interactions
    Detecting of misalignments between promotion links and landing pages Interacting with mobile and wearable devices
